original_title: Sri Lanka stocks close down, low turnover
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed down on Tuesday, CSE data showed.
The All Share Price Index was down 0.57 percent, or 60.50 points, at 10,612.
The S&P SL20 index was down 0.80 percent, or 24.64 points, at 3,050.
Turnover continued to be low at 566 million. Most of this came from the food, beverage and tobacco sector (110 million).
Positive contributors to the ASPI were Amana Bank Plc (up at 2.30), Richard Pieris and Company Plc (up at 20.40), and Overseas Realty (Ceylon) Plc (up at 15.70).
